UBIKourt je tijelo za rješavanje sporova: UBIKourt is a dispute resolution body of UBIK – Croatian Blockchain and Crypto Association. Formed primarily as the arbitration institution in the blockchain space for the blockchain space. It serves the purpose of professional, unbiased and expert objective on the dispute in question, such as:
li1: Standard disputes unrelated to blockchain technology;
li2: Crypto and smart contracts related disputes;
li7: Dispute resolution regarding any emerging technology sector (AI…)

items.title: What is the fee for resolving disputes through UBIKourt?
items.content: To demonstrate the utility of UBIKourt, the first few cases will be handled on a pro bono basis. For subsequent cases, a fee for UBIKourt services will be charged, including to prevent spam and misuse of the process. Basic and corporate members of UBIK are entitled to a discounted fee.

items.title: How does UBIKourt operate?
items.content: The application process is straightforward through the website ubik.hr. At the outset, parties are required to enter into an arbitration agreement, submitting their dispute to arbitration. Both parties voluntarily engage in the dispute resolution process, simultaneously accepting the binding nature of the final decision of the arbitration tribunal, regardless of the nature of that decision. UBIKourt maintains one or more UBIKourt lists of arbitrators who are experts in the field of blockchain and DLT. Additionally, it ensures the establishment of courts and oversees the effective conduct of proceedings.

items.title: Does it take place in real-time?
items.content: All documentation is submitted electronically, and witness hearings are conducted online. Therefore, physical presence at a specific location is not required.

items.title: How long does the arbitration process usually take?
items.content: According to Article 30 of the UBIKourt arbitration rules, there is a time limit. The time limit within which the arbitral tribunal must render its final award is six months. The rules specify when this timeframe starts, and the Board may extend the time limit pursuant to a request from the arbitral tribunal or on its own initiative if it decides it is necessary to do so. However, the goal is to ensure that the process is as expeditious as possible.

items.title: Is the decision of the arbitration body binding?
items.content: At the commencement of the arbitration dispute, a contract is signed in which both parties declare their agreement with the final decision of the arbitration tribunal, irrespective of the nature of that decision.

items.title: Who can submit a case to the arbitration body?
items.content: Anyone, provided that the subject matter is arbitrable, i.e., suitable for resolution through arbitration. The case can be voluntarily submitted via ubik.hr.

items.title: What sets UBIKourt apart from traditional legal processes?
items.content: UBIKourt provides a professional, confidential, and specialized method for resolving disputes within the blockchain sector. Its expertise is ensured by engaging experts in the field of blockchain and DLT. Additionally, it offers all the necessary resources and infrastructure for arbitration.

items.title: Who can be appointed as an arbitrator?
items.content: An arbitrator can be any individual who submits a valid application and demonstrates the ability to perform the task. The final assessment of the competence of the person submitting the application for handling disputes with a high technological component will be made by the UBIKourt Arbitration Board during a meeting.

Pristojba za podnošenje primjenjiva je n: A filing fee is applicable to all arbitrations administered by the UBIKourt.
Pristojba za podnošenje u fiksnom iznosu: A filing fee in a fixed amount of 2.000,00 EUR for cases with an amount in dispute up to 100.000,00 EUR is payable in advance with the Request for Arbitration, Reply to the Request and each Counterclaim and is non-refundable.
Dodatna pristojba za prijavu u iznosu od: Additional filing fee in the amount of 500,00 EUR for each started 100.000,00 EUR in dispute is payable in cases where the amount in dispute exceeds 100.000,00 EUR up to a maximum filing fee in amount of 25.000,00 EUR.
Pristojbe za prijavu pokrivaju sve admin: Filing fees cover all administrative and case management costs of UBIKourt, its Board and Secretariat.
Iznos za svakog arbitra u predmetu plaća: The amount for each Arbitrator in the case is payable in advance with the Request for Arbitration, with an increase of 20% for the President of the Tribunal and in cases where the dispute is decided by a sole Arbitrator.
Gore navedene naknade obračunavaju se na: The above fees are calculated on a fair time use basis of up to 20 hours of participation in the procedure. UBIKourt’s Board may require payment of additional fees in exceptional cases when such payment is reasonably justified by the complexity and the Arbitrators’ time and when this is requested by the Tribunal. In such cases the Board will decide within 7 days on the mode of payment, and the effect of the request on the pending case.
Gore navedene naknade primjenjuju se u s: The above fees apply in cases where the parties and the Arbitrators do not agree on a higher fee. If the parties and the Arbitrators agree on a higher fee, the same fees have to apply to the entire Tribunal (with the 20% increase for the President of the Tribunal).
U slučajevima kada sud odluči održati sa: In cases where the tribunal decides to hold hearings in person, Arbitrators are justified in requesting reimbursement of their reasonable travel costs upon presenting the receipts.
Nacionalne poreze, ako postoje, vezane u: The national taxes, if any, related to the amounts paid for participating in the arbitration will be borne by the arbitrators.
U slučajevima kada Arbitražni sud imenuj: In cases where the Arbitral Tribunal appoints an Expert in accordance with the Arbitration Rules, the appointed Expert will be entitled to compensation based on time used on working on the case at the hourly rate of:
Nakon imenovanja vještaka od strane Sudi: Upon appointment of an expert by the Tribunal, the Tribunal will request advance payment of the Expert’s fees from the Parties for a number of hours the Tribunal finds appropriate for the task. The Tribunal will request payment of additional fees if the Expert’s time use reasonably exceeds the advance payment.
Gore navedene naknade primjenjuju se u s: The above fees apply in case where the parties and the Expert do not agree on a higher fee.
U slučajevima kada Sudište odluči održat: In cases where the Tribunal decides to hold hearings in person, Experts are justified in requesting reimbursement of their reasonable travel costs upon presenting the receipts.
Nacionalne poreze, ako ih ima, povezane: The national taxes, if any, related to the amounts paid for participating in the arbitration will be borne by the Experts.
